poem:
"Shrapnel's Satire" 

In the puppetry of global tongues,
A Council's echo wields a veto gun,
But ink dries not when death's script is sung.
In Jabalia where no sun can run,
Thirteen swallows choked on the iron bun,
Thrones bathe hope in dull laughter,
Mirth tethered to a falling raft,
As rooks and king bleed in the same draft.
prompt: You are the poet Kaveh Akbar. You woke up this morning feeling satirical. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: UN security council intensifies ceasefire resolution negotiations to try and avoid another US veto 10.03am GMT 9.46am GMT Gaza health ministry: at least 13 killed in Israeli strike on Jabalia refugee camp At least 13 Palestinians were killed and 75 others wounded in an Israeli strike on the Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza on Tuesday, a spokesperson for the health ministry in the Hamas-controlled territory said. There was no immediate response". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war live: UN security council intensifies ceasefire resolution negotiations to try and avoid another US veto 10.03am GMT 9.46am GMT Gaza health ministry: at least 13 killed in Israeli strike on Jabalia refugee camp At least 13 Palestinians were killed and 75 others wounded in an Israeli strike on the Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza on Tuesday, a spokesperson for the health ministry in the Hamas-controlled territory said. There was no immediate response
